column4: hey everyone, I've got a little bug that's bugging me.  I'm trying to run amarok (it was working last night, but crashed) and ps aux | grepping it found the process, but I'm not seeing it at all on my X session.  Any clues?
also, what's that terminal mp3 player?
does it play any/all MP3s from a directory at random?
thank you, lojikal .
go to ~/.Trash and rm the files, tuskernini./
Welcome, tuskernini.
bah.  this is ticking me off.  x.x  I go crazy without MP3s  :D  I either need some sort of terminal MP3 player or get amarok back working again.
was about to say that, |Jason8|.  You beat me to it.
mpd?
mpd is command line, also beep media player is xmms but newer basically
but sound is fine from mpg123-alsa or mpg123?
I would check alsamixer and make sure all the levels are set correctly
check alsamixer and make sure you have the levels turned up
The levels are fine.
not sure this applies for you but when i was getting my digital out to work i was having problems with low volume because my ac97 levels werent all the way to 0
whats wrong with amarok
you could also try exhaile its supposed to be amarok with gtk more or less
not showing up? tries to load and then doesnt?
does amarok still play? is it only the gui that is messed up?
open a console and do amarok --play
amarok depends on kde is why
first I would try to run amarok as a different user
